mkdir -p ~/.ssh
chmod 700 ~/.ssh 
cp /config/* ~/.ssh/
echo $'\n' >> ~/.ssh/id_*
restic unlock
restic backup /data
restic forget --keep-weekly 1 --prune

mkdir -p ~/.ssh
chmod 700 ~/.ssh 
cp /config/* ~/.ssh/
echo $'\n' >> ~/.ssh/id_* 
restic init || true

gitlab_enterprise:
  bot:
    username: Codecov

setup:
  debug: no
  loglvl: INFO

  guest_access: off
  admins:
    - service: gitlab_enterprise
      username: Saphir
    - service: gitlab_enterprise
      username: Alexsaphir

  http:
    cookies_domain: ${DOMAIN_NAME}

  timeseries:
    enabled: false

  telemetry:
    enabled: false

notifications:
  slack: off
  gitter: off
  webhook: off
  irc: off
  hipchat: off

cd /opt/cloudbeaver \
&& cp -R conf drivers run-server.sh samples server web /cb/ \
&& chown 1000:1000 -R /cb/* \
&& ls -lah /cb/

until pg_isready -h vaultwarden-postgresql-rw -U vaultwarden; do
  echo "Waiting for PostgreSQL to be ready..."
  sleep 2
done

/hr/ghcr.io-home-operations-charts-mirro.title: external-dns helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-home-operations-charts-mirro.name: external-dns
/hr/ghcr.io-home-operations-charts-mirro.doc: ExternalDNS is a Kubernetes add-on that automatically manages the creation and updates of DNS records for services running in your cluster. It integrates with a variety of DNS providers, such as CloudFlare DNS, Amazon Route 53, Google Cloud DNS, and more, to ensure that your applications are easily accessible from anywhere with a DNS name. With ExternalDNS, you can simplify the process of managing DNS records for your home lab, eliminating the need for manual updates and reducing the risk of errors.

/hr/ghcr.io-home-operations-charts-mirro.title: k8s-gateway helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-home-operations-charts-mirro.name: k8s-gateway
/hr/ghcr.io-home-operations-charts-mirro.doc:
k8s_gateway is a CoreDNS plugin that resolves all types of external Kubernetes resources.

It will gather all domains from all services, ingresses, and HTTPRoutes resources and create a DNS record for each of them, corresponding to the service IPs. This ensures that all external resources are resolved from within the cluster, and traffic is not leaving the cluster.

Most people deploy the k8s_gateway together with CoreDNS and call the Helm Release 'k8s-gateway'. This can be supplimenting along side the kube-dns or default CoreDNS from k3s.
